update.description:
This is a proposed set of changes that would alter the default WAMV to have it’s topics reorganised into namespaces based on type, including sensors, cameras and thrusters.  A global namespace is set using the spawn\_models namespace capability that would allow multiple robots to be run in a single simulation.

* Created new branch topic\_namespace\_generation
* Add support for namespaces This includes thruster, camera and sensor namespaces, as well as a global namespace allowing multiple vehicles to be created without causing interference.
* Add sensor namepsace to planar lidar Remove gloabl namespace
* Fix namepsaces to work with robotNamespace parameter
update.title: Topic namespace generation

content.html: There was a problem running RViz that has been addressed in pull request #158. Could you merge from default and I’ll give it another try?

content.raw: One more suggestion. Maybe `/wamv/sensors/lidar/` should be `/wamv/sensors/lidars/`? We can have more than one lidar.

content.raw:
Hi Carlos,

* Main launch file has had a namespace parameter added.  This has also been used to set the name of the gazebo model.
* Sensor namespaces have been altered as discussed.
* RViz configuration files have been updated with the new namespaces.
* Updated localisation example.  The tf names have also had the namespace prepended.
* Updated teleoperation examples.

Regards,

Jonathan.
content.html:
Hi Carlos,

  • Main launch file has had a namespace parameter added. This has also been used to set the name of the gazebo model.
  • Sensor namespaces have been altered as discussed.
  • RViz configuration files have been updated with the new namespaces.
  • Updated localisation example. The tf names have also had the namespace prepended.
  • Updated teleoperation examples.

Regards,

Jonathan.

content.raw:
Hmmm, possibly.  

I find myself warming to this idea., especially if we have teams using multiple lidars.

Regards,

Jonathan.

Hmmm, possibly.

I find myself warming to this idea., especially if we have teams using multiple lidars.

content.raw:
It’s great that people think different :slight_smile:

One more clarification, at least for the VRX competition, teams can install up to two 3D lidars.

I can be convinced otherwise, but I like consistency. Is the solution to add a namespace to all the sensors?

```
/sensor/camera/middle_right/...
/sensor/3d_lidar/front/...
/sensor/3d_lidar/right/...
/sensor/gps/my_gps/...
/sensor/imu/my_imu/...
```
content.html:
It’s great that people think different

One more clarification, at least for the VRX competition, teams can install up to two 3D lidars.

I can be convinced otherwise, but I like consistency. Is the solution to add a namespace to all the sensors?

/sensor/camera/middle_right/...

/sensor/3d_lidar/right/...
/sensor/gps/my_gps/...
/sensor/imu/my_imu/...

This is a proposed set of changes that would alter the default WAMV to have it’s topics reorganised into namespaces based on type, including sensors, cameras and thrusters.  A global namespace is set using the spawn\_models namespace capability that would allow multiple robots to be run in a single simulation.

* Created new branch topic\_namespace\_generation

update.title: Topic namespace generation

content.raw:
Hi Carlos,

I have to disagree with you here, I think cameras are special for three reasons;

* They are the only sensor that it is commonly installed in multiples.  
* In VRX, these sensors are also named for the position they hold e.g. /middle\_right\_camera.  The GPS, Lidar and IMU sensors are named after their type.
* They also generate multiple image streams with different properties.  For this reason, when recording bag data, I like to record all topics but excluding camera topics.  Putting 

Changing /midle\_right\_camera/ to /cameras/middle\_right does not add any extra characters to the topic name, while still grouping them together logically.  For this reason, I think it is reasonable to give cameras there own subnamespace.  

Regards,

Jonathan
content.html:
Hi Carlos,

I have to disagree with you here, I think cameras are special for three reasons;

  • They are the only sensor that it is commonly installed in multiples.
  • In VRX, these sensors are also named for the position they hold e.g. /middle_right_camera. The GPS, Lidar and IMU sensors are named after their type.
  • They also generate multiple image streams with different properties. For this reason, when recording bag data, I like to record all topics but excluding camera topics. Putting

Changing /midle_right_camera/ to /cameras/middle_right does not add any extra characters to the topic name, while still grouping them together logically. For this reason, I think it is reasonable to give cameras there own subnamespace.

Regards,

Jonathan

content.raw:
@{5b9791e8a9fd6d2c834b5864} , I believe these are the outstanding comments:

* Avoid the `cameras` namespace for consistency \(if you all agree\).
* Update the `.rviz` config files. You’ll need to update the topics.
* Update `wamv_gazebo/launch/localization_example.launch` . This is needed for running rviz and needs to be updated with the new GPS and IMU topics.
content.html:
@Jonathan Wheare , I believe these are the outstanding comments:

  • Avoid the cameras namespace for consistency (if you all agree).
  • Update the .rviz config files. You’ll need to update the topics.
  • Update wamv_gazebo/launch/localization_example.launch . This is needed for running rviz and needs to be updated with the new GPS and IMU topics.

content.raw: I'm actually more in favor of the former because all topics are now consistent with `/wamv/sensors/<sensor_name>/<sensor_data>`. Otherwise the cameras are special, as they have one extra namespace.
content.html: I'm actually more in favor of the former because all topics are now consistent with /wamv/sensors/<sensor_name>/<sensor_data>. Otherwise the cameras are special, as they have one extra namespace.

content.raw: I believe merging this PR will change the “VRX API” as documented int the VRX Technical Guide document \(see [Documentation wiki](#!/osrf/vrx/wiki/documentation)\).  If/when we merge the PR we should coordinate with the next release of the document - version 1.2.
content.html: I believe merging this PR will change the “VRX API” as documented int the VRX Technical Guide document (see Documentation wiki). If/when we merge the PR we should coordinate with the next release of the document - version 1.2.

content.raw: Should now be fixed.  I will push the change shortly.
content.html: Should now be fixed. I will push the change shortly.

content.raw: Fixed.  ROS apparently filters out repeated slashes, but it could cause issues when the sensor\_namespace is empty.
content.html: Fixed. ROS apparently filters out repeated slashes, but it could cause issues when the sensor_namespace is empty.

content.raw: I think that we should have one namespace for sensors and cameras located under that sensors namespace along with the other sensors like gps, imu, ect. Apart from this and my comments, I think this is a good PR.
content.html: I think that we should have one namespace for sensors and cameras located under that sensors namespace along with the other sensors like gps, imu, ect. Apart from this and my comments, I think this is a good PR.

content.raw: why is there a slash after `${sensor_namespace}`? will this not evaluate to `sensors//gps/fix_velocity`?
content.html: why is there a slash after ${sensor_namespace}? will this not evaluate to sensors//gps/fix_velocity?

content.raw: why is there a slash between `${thruster_namespace}` and `${name}`? Will this not evaluate to `thrusters//${name}` ?
content.html: why is there a slash between ${thruster_namespace} and ${name}? Will this not evaluate to thrusters//${name} ?
